timeline.bodyText: If some exceptions happen in this block, we still call invalidation in the finally. We don't do this in the new code. Is it OK if we have an exceptional scenario? It seems in the new implementation we handle failures only on commit.
timeline.author: petrpleshachkov

replies.bodyText: Yes it is ok not to have that finally block. The right place to apply invalidations is commit phase. Depending on the failure or success near cache interaction should happen in there.
replies.author: ahmetmircik
